etymology.description: 亻(亻) (rén, "person") + 𠤎(𠤎) (rén, "person") upside down = two people, one upright, one reversed -> transformation or change
etymology.interpretation: The character 化(化) (huà, "transform") visually represents change or transformation, signified by two 人(人) (rén, "person") characters in opposite orientations, suggesting reversal or alteration.

examples.chinese: 科学进步(科學進步)，推动社会化转型(推動社會化轉型)。
examples.pinyin: Kēxué jìnbù, tuīdòng shèhuì huà zhuǎnxíng.

examples.chinese: 时间能让伤痛化作记忆(時間能讓傷痛化作記憶)。
examples.pinyin: Shíjiān néng ràng shāngtòng huà zuò jìyì.

examples.chinese: 困境中他不断努力(困境中他不斷努力)，生命终将化为辉煌(生命終將化為輝煌)。
examples.pinyin: Kùnjìng zhōng tā bùduàn nǔlì, shēngmìng zhōng jiāng huà wéi huīhuáng.
examples.english: Amid difficulties he perseveres, and his life will eventually transform into brilliance.
